oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter of Hank Gage to John and Portia Gage
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cpl. Gage, Co. G, 96th Ill. Inf. Regt., was from a family of ardent abolitionists. He fought in the Chattanooga Campaign, returning to his camp after a "very successful crusade." Gage hopes rumors of the war's end are true, but many "newspaper accounts; are abominable lies." Independence is what he is here for, and he explains there is a difference between conquest and conquered. Gage expresses strong feelings about ministers and chaplains. Letter is written in crosshatch style.
